newsitem.title: USA: Tandem CFO departs, realigns senior mgmt.
newsitem.headline: Tandem CFO departs, realigns senior mgmt.

text.p: Tandem Computers Inc said that David Rynne, its chief financial officer, has resigned to accept a position as CFO of Bay Networks Inc, leading Tandem to realign its senior management.
Tandem said that it promoted Kenneth Barber to senior vice president, finance and corporate controller, reporting to Enrico Pesatori, president and chief operating officer.

Barber will assume responsibility for global business planning, financial planning and financial management. Pesatori will assume responsibility for operational units formerly reporting to Rynne, who was with Tandem 14 years.
Pesatori will act as interim chief financial officer until a replacement is named.
Barber was most recently vice president of finance, sales and support as well as vice president of finance for Tandem's systems development and manufacturing group. He joined Tandem in 1989.
